text: MotionClip
Converts a skeleton animation to a MotionClip
This SOP takes as input a skeleton animation (eg. from
FbxAnimImport

The output consists of a list of packed primitives. The first contains
the skeleton topology evaluated at the given rest frame. The remaining
primitives each represent a cached frame, they contain a list of points
which represent the position of each joint.
This output can be fed into
MotionClipEvaluate

to
efficiently display a frame of the cached animation.
Pack Inputs

If this is selected each input’s clip will be placed into its own
        packed primitive. Otherwise the node will only accept a single
        input, and the clip will be outputted directly.
Rest Frame
The clip’s clipinfo attribute will be given by the input evaluated at this frame. If
Use First Frame for Topology
is off, this frame will also be used for the topology of the MotionClip’s skeleton.
Sample Rate
The rate at which to sample the input animation.
Frame Range

The range of the input frames to grab. If disabled,
        the
clipinfo
detail attribute of the source will be used.
Left End Behavior
Sets the left end behavior of the clip. This determines how the animation should behave when it is evaluated before the start of the MotionClip.
Clamp
The first and last poses will be extended out indefinitely.
Loop
The animation will repeat from the beginning.
Mirrored Loop
The animation will repeat in reverse.
Right End Behavior
Sets the right end behavior of the clip. This determines how the animation should behave when it is evaluated after the end of the MotionClip.
Clamp
The first and last poses will be extended out indefinitely.
Loop
The animation will repeat from the beginning.
Mirrored Loop
The animation will repeat in reverse.
Reload Method

States whether the clip should be automatically reloaded
        when the input is changed.
Attributes to Store

A string matching the attributes that you wish to be copied
        from the input into the MotionClip.
Recompute Local Transforms

If this is selected, the 'localtransform' attribute of each frame of the inputs will be recomputed before the frame is stored. This should be enabled if the input has both world and local space transform attributes and the local space transforms are not in sync with the world space transforms.
Use First Frame for Topology

If enabled, the first frame of each input animation will be used as the topology of the skeleton for the corresponding MotionClip.
        Otherwise, the pose evaluated at the
Rest Frame
will be used as this topology.
Reload
Forces a reload of the input. Useful in manual mode.
Input Operators
This defines the order of the MotionClips when packing inputs.
First input
The skeleton animation to be cached.
Nth input

If pack inputs is selected each input’s clip
        will be stored in its own packed primitive.
The cached skeleton animation.
